column5: Sitting down to dinner and look out across the road to see a wild turkey hen on the grass. I'm in dowtown Oakville though just a few blocks from the lake. They're everywhere!  UPDATE after dinner  Still walking around the neighbourhood like it hasn't a care in the world. I know my beagle is about ready to go through the front window.

Saddly Paul,the turkeys took a big hit on the property I hunt from the yotes. I do have a large tom and 2 jakes and 7 hens,thats all I have seen and been reported. Far cry from the 3-5 herums I had 4-5 years ago. There has been more deer sightings then turkey. Go figure.  I have the 26th booked off.Will see what the opener brings.

You would be correct Rich.I was looking at the wrong year.  Working so much,I dont even know what day it is half the time. Thanks for the correction.  http://ca.wrs.yahoo.com/_ylt=A0oG75wtxKxNJhEASavrFAx.;_ylu=X3oDMTBybnZlZnRlBHNlYwNzcgRwb3MDMQRjb2xvA2FjMgR2dGlkAw--/SIG=13ckeajh8/EXP=1303254445/**http%3a//www.mnr.gov.on.ca/stdprodconsume/groups/lr/@mnr/@fw/documents/document/239847.pdf
So with that.. the answer would be YES, the 25th !
Look at the spurs on her.Would put a tom to shame.  No scence heading your way Wayne,as they only come out when Leah yells out"ok boys,thier gone,come on out now".
they will only be stupid for another week. Good luck to who ever is going out.
